page.title: 01Coastline sth of Gairloch
page.content: Landscape- undulating moorland rising to 110m in south. Rocky coastline with sandy bay at Opinan. People - there are two small crofting setlements at Opinan, and South Erradale. The crofts however are not adequate to provide an income by themselves, and people find work elsewhere when available. They live here because their ancestors lived here,bu they depend heavily upon Gairloch 8 miles away. Many people speak Gaelic. Sunday is srictly observed,there are two small meeting places in the area. The Post Office is at Opinan, and there are no other shops, except a craft shop at S. Erradale. Some tweed weaving id done here, to attract the tourist. A coffee lounge and a restaurant also have an eye to the tourist. There is some peat cutting on the moor for fuel.
